original_title: Le Festival de Cannes : une affaire d'État(s)
overview: From 1939 to 1972, every film being selected by its own country of origin, the Cannes Film Festival was a diplomatic ballet and the object of much wider issues than a cinema screen. Post-war, cold war, wars of independence, muffled propaganda ... this historical documentary approaches a Festival under influence and sheds light on controversies that have remained in the blind spot
title: Le Festival de Cannes : une affaire d'État(s)
